headline: Delta earnings, Fed commentary, mortgage rates: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, October 9, including corporate earnings results from PepsiCo (PEP), Delta Air Lines (DAL), and Levi Strauss (LEVI); the latest commentary from Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell and other prominent officials; and weekly mortgage rate readings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: A Fresh Look at PepsiCo (PEP) Valuation Following Activist Investor Calls for Change and Key Earnings Update
summary: PepsiCo (PEP) drew increased attention after activist investor Elliott Investment Management publicly pushed for major changes to the company’s North America Beverages unit. These calls for greater accountability come as PepsiCo prepares to release its latest quarterly earnings. See our latest analysis for PepsiCo. Amid the recent activist push and upcoming earnings, PepsiCo’s share price has dipped about 6% year-to-date and remains down roughly 14% on a total shareholder return basis over...
